identificationModule.briefTitle: Ultrasound-detectable Endotracheal Tube: a Feasibility Study
identificationModule.officialTitle: Ultrasound-detectable Endotracheal Tube: a Feasibility Study

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Professor of Pediatric Cardiology, Professor of Pediatrics

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The researchers are studying whether special features make it easier to see if the breathing tube is in the correct place. It is hoped that the investigational device will enable more accurate placement (depth and trachea vs. esophagus).
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
The participant will have a breathing tube where the balloon (cuff) at the end of the tube has two special features: 1) The balloon will have a divot in it, rather than be round in shape, and 2) The balloon will be filled with saline (salt water), rather than air. The breathing tube is called an ultrasound detectable cuffed endotracheal tube (USD-ETT).

The USD-ETT has not been tested or used in humans previously.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: The outcomes assessor is "blinded" for outcome measure 4. Specifically the protocol says, "After each case is completed, the fluoroscopic images and ultrasound images will be interpreted by independent study team members who are blinded to the results of the other test."

armGroups.label: Ultrasound detectable cuffed endotracheal tube (USD-ETT)
armGroups.description: Intubation with a novel ultrasound-detectable endotracheal tube
interventionNames: Device: Ultrasound detectable cuffed endotracheal tube (USD-ETT)

interventions.name: Ultrasound detectable cuffed endotracheal tube (USD-ETT)
interventions.description: Intubation with a novel ultrasound-detectable endotracheal tube

primaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of the USD-ETTs visualized by ultrasound
primaryOutcomes.description: Reported as a 'yes' or 'no' - this outcome simply seeks to verify if the ultrasound can detect the ultrasound detectable cuffed endotracheal tube. The outcome measure assesses if the device is detectable as designed. It does not assess health related information.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 5 minutes of placing the ultrasound probe at the suprasternal notch after intubation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Adverse events that could be related to the USD-ETT device
Safely support ventilation and oxygenation of the patient during the procedure
secondaryOutcomes.description: Assessed by the question: "Were there any desaturation events, inability to property ventilate the patient or, blood gas abnormalities, that could be attributable to the ETT?" will be described

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Kappa agreement between placement location of USD-ETT as assessed by ultrasound and fluoroscopy
secondaryOutcomes.description: Ultrasound location data compared to fluoroscopy location data using a weighted Kappa statistic
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Approximately 5 minutes after of placing the ultrasound probe at the suprasternal notch after intubation

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patient is undergoing scheduled or planned diagnostic or interventional cardiac catheterization with planned general anesthesia requiring endotracheal intubation.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patient has a known airway abnormality, including tracheal stenosis, previous tracheal stenosis, or tracheobronchomalacia.
* Patient has a tracheostomy.
* Patient is ventilator-dependent.
* Patient has an anticipated difficult intubation based upon airway exam and/or history of difficult intubation.
* Patient is unlikely (in opinion of anesthesia team) or is unable to be intubated with 3.5 mm, 4.0 mm, or 4.5 mm Inner Diameter USD-ETT due to the size of the patient or their airway.
* Patient is already intubated prior to the scheduled procedure.
* It is anticipated that the patient will not be extubated after the catheterization procedure.
* Concurrent enrollment in another clinical trial with an intervention during the cardiac catheterization procedure or 30 days afterwards.
* Allergy to plastic/materials in USD-ETT
